ReportSection.name: Executive Summary
ReportSection.title: 1. Executive Summary
ReportSection.ReportItem:
Report Description

Each WP is asked to collect information and examples from across its constituent members/projects in order to complete a 4-5 page WP Report. Responses will be used to help the Network Management Office to construct the 2015/16 AGE-WELL Annual Report which NCE will use to evaluate AGE-WELL this spring. WPs are not individually evaluated on the content of these reports.

Note that the information requested in Sections 1 and 2 is drawn directly from the NCE Annual Report template. Section 3 enables WPs to highlight additional outcomes or benefits of network membership not captured elsewhere in the report. Given the brevity of the report, we are looking for concrete examples from across each WP as opposed to a full accounting of all WP activities. Should you have more to share with us than space limitations permit, please contact jeanie@agewell-nce.ca

Executive Summary

Describe the top three achievements, successes, contributions, success stories from your WP and their impacts as they relate to the realization of AGE-WELL goals and objectives.

{$item}

ReportSection.name: NCE Evaluation Criteria
ReportSection.title: 2. Evaluation Criteria
ReportSection.ReportItem:
a) Excellence of the Research Program (3600 characters / ¾ pg)

AGE-WELL’s research program is driven to address Canadian needs and problems, and is therefore expected to be multidisciplinary and multisectoral.  We are evaluated on the excellence, focus and coherence of the research program. For your WP, please comment on the follow providing concrete examples where possible.

  • Describe the balance between discovery and application-based research in this WP
  • Describe the ways in which the work of this WP is addressing new and emerging social and ethical challenges
  • Highlight any notable achievements of researchers within your WP, including publications in top-tier journals, leadership awards etc
  • Provide examples from within your WP of international leadership or activities that have contributed to the visibility of AGE-WELL domestically or abroad
{$item}

b) Development of Highly Qualified Personnel (2000 characters ½ pg)

The training and retention of HQP is imperative to maximize the effectiveness of the Networks’ contribution to the wealth, wellness and well-being of Canadians. The multidisciplinary and multisectoral nature of a network should be utilized to provide unique mentorship and training opportunities to maximize HQP retention and integration in all facets of the workforce.

  • Give examples from your WP of HQP being provided with novel, transdisciplinary or innovative experiences, including examples of exposure to the economic, social or ethical implications of AGE-WELL research through training opportunities.
  • Give examples of any new training initiatives developed from AGE-WELL work (e.g. training modules in your WP area, for example)
  • If relevant, please highlight examples of HQP leadership / career development related to the knowledge mobilization of commercialization such as launching a start-up company, filing patents, hosting stakeholder consultations etc.
{$item}

c) Networking and Partnerships (3600 characters/ ¾ pg)

AGE-WELL must demonstrate that it has brought together the key individuals and organizations needed to generate and implement multifaceted solutions to the complex Canadian challenges it is designed to address.

  • Describe new collaborations developed during the reporting period (e.g. new links between national and international academic institutions, federal and provincial agencies, non-governmental organizations and private sector participants). Who was involved and what activities did the team engage in?
  • Describe any examples of optimization of resources through the sharing of equipment and research facilities, databases and personnel within this WP.
  • Describe cross-WP or cross-Project activities that your team engaged in this year, highlighting examples of working transdisciplinarily.
{$item}

d) Knowledge Exchange and Exploitation (3600 characters / ¾ pg)

NCE networks are expected to generate social and economic benefits by ensuring the rapid flow of ideas and innovations from researchers to Canadian receptors.

  • Highlight notable KTEE successes such as new products, processes or services with commercial potential; social innovations that may contribute to public policy in Canada.
  • Describe examples of effective collaboration with the private, public and not-for-profit sectors in technology, market development, and public policy development
{$item}

ReportSection.name: Additional Information
ReportSection.title: 3. Additional Information
ReportSection.ReportItem:
a) Other Outcomes

While it is important that we demonstrate achievement in the NCE Program areas above, we realize that there are other ways to define success and achievement relevant to AGE-WELL’s mission and vision. In this section, please describe any success or achievements that you would like to highlight that have not been covered in the sections above.

{$item}

b) Benefits of Network Involvement

NCEs ideally provide its members with benefits and opportunities that are realizable through a multisectoral networked approach. Please describe any benefits accrued by your team(s) resulting from your specific involvement in AGE-WELL (e.g. team cohesion, access to new partners etc.)

{$item}

ReportSection.name: Submit
ReportSection.ReportItem: By generating a PDF your application is automatically submitted.
